_meta.description: Pattern libraries for detecting taste state violations
_meta.usage: Scan text for trigger patterns; check severity modifiers; consider context exceptions

T1_institutional_cartoon.name: Institutional Cartoon
T1_institutional_cartoon.description: Simplistic portrayals of institutions as uniformly dumb or evil
triggers: what they don't want you to know
context_exceptions: Spoken by unreliable narrator with later correction
Critique of character's worldview, not author's
fix_suggestions: Show specific constraints the institution faces
Add internal perspective from someone within the system
Explain failure through incentives, not stupidity
Show competent people trapped by structural issues

T2_cynicism_as_cleverness.name: Cynicism as Cleverness
T2_cynicism_as_cleverness.description: Snark and nihilism substituting for insight
context_exceptions: Character in depression arc with later growth
Cynicism shown as character flaw being addressed
fix_suggestions: Ground critique in specific mechanisms
Show what's actually at stake
Give cynical character something to care about
Distinguish earned skepticism from performative nihilism

T3_worldbuilding_dominance.name: Worldbuilding Dominance
T3_worldbuilding_dominance.description: Story stops for exposition; setting overwhelms character
structural_patterns: Three or more paragraphs of pure exposition
Character asks obvious question to trigger info-dump
New character introduced primarily to explain
fix_suggestions: Deliver world info through character experience
Integrate exposition with action
Cut to essential details only
Let mystery remain—reader doesn't need everything explained

T4_narrator_commentary.name: Narrator Commentary
T4_narrator_commentary.description: Author voice intrudes; wit comes from outside story
voice_inconsistencies: Vocabulary suddenly shifts to modern slang in period piece
Character makes pop culture reference they wouldn't know
Narration more clever than POV character would be
context_exceptions: Framed as character's journal or testimony
fix_suggestions: Ground wit in character perspective
Keep vocabulary consistent with POV
Let humor arise from situation
If meta-commentary needed, frame it clearly

T5_unearned_impossibility.name: Unearned Impossibility
T5_unearned_impossibility.description: Magic/mystery is arbitrary; no internal logic
structural_patterns: Resolution depends on previously unestablished element
context_exceptions: Mystery meant to remain mysterious (with thematic purpose)
Early in story with later explanation
Character POV—they don't understand, but rules exist
fix_suggestions: Establish internal rules for impossibility
Plant hints for later revelation
Ensure mystery rewards attention on re-read
Give even strange things consistent logic

T6_bumbling_for_plot.name: Bumbling for Plot
T6_bumbling_for_plot.description: Characters fail stupidly to serve story convenience
structural_patterns: Character's intelligence varies by scene needs
context_exceptions: Character is established as fallible in this way
Stress or time pressure explains oversight
Failure comes from constraint, not incompetence
fix_suggestions: Give character real constraints that cause failure
Establish character limitations early
Create genuine obstacles, not manufactured ones
Let competent characters be competent

T7_baroque_complexity.name: Baroque Complexity
T7_baroque_complexity.description: Complexity for its own sake; depth confused with intricacy
structural_patterns: Subplots that don't resolve or connect
Philosophical tangents that don't serve story
fix_suggestions: Ask what each layer accomplishes
Simplify to essence without losing meaning
Ensure complexity serves story function
Cut what's clever but not necessary
